summary.raw: @caguero to be merged after the merge of pull request #151

values.description:
* adding poisson's ratio and elastic modulus
* restrict spheres to 1 single contact
* update model
* update contact properties
* enable physics test, setup a grasp in test. adding a pinch test
* fix index ab-ad for cylindrical grasp
* rename haptixJoints to simJoints, better matches what they are.
    * added clutch limit pinching mechanism.
    * add referenceJoint for gearboxes.
    * add JointHelper::GetRealJoint to access gazebo joint.
    * added differential transmission.
    * added thread_position_correction for performance.
    * add joint spring implementation.
    * refactor hand control update.
values.title: Test_curvature

values.description:
I added the world file (ffdb75c), so to test,

  - download luke hand model from deka, copy `luke_hand_description` into `~/.gazebo/models/`
  - run `gazebo --verbose worlds/luke_hand.world`

Changes/Updates:

* add arm sensor offset sdf parsing.
* add a torque filter.
* add joint clutching
* updates to transmission, misc fixes.
* adding poisson's ratio and elastic modulus
* restrict spheres to 1 single contact
* update model
* update contact properties
* enable physics test, setup a grasp in test. adding a pinch test
* fix index ab-ad for cylindrical grasp
* rename haptixJoints to simJoints, better matches what they are.
    * added clutch limit pinching mechanism.
    * add referenceJoint for gearboxes.
    * add JointHelper::GetRealJoint to access gazebo joint.
    * added differential transmission.
    * added thread_position_correction for performance.
    * add joint spring implementation.
    * refactor hand control update.
values.title: update transmission, add clutch.

values.description:
The problem pointed out at [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/278/haptix_world_sim_api/diff#chg-haptix_world_sim_api/tutorial.md) pull request was due to infinite force being multiplied by zero and generating a NaN, which cannot be handled by the clamp function.

Here I just did a workaround to use the maximum color in case of infinite force.


`inf * 0 = nan` :boom:
values.title: Clamp color at maximum force to avoid multiplying inf by zero

summary.raw:
The problem pointed out at [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/278/haptix_world_sim_api/diff#chg-haptix_world_sim_api/tutorial.md) pull request was due to infinite force being multiplied by zero and generating a NaN, which cannot be handled by the clamp function.

Here I just did a workaround to use the maximum color in case of infinite force.


`inf * 0 = nan` :boom:
summary.html:
The problem pointed out at this pull request was due to infinite force being multiplied by zero and generating a NaN, which cannot be handled by the clamp function.

Here I just did a workaround to use the maximum color in case of infinite force.

inf * 0 = nan

values.title: add attribute to specify sim only joints that do not go out to the haptix api
reduce set of contact visuals to match mujoco

values.description: [This Ignition Transport pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/95/remove-topic-name-from-user-callbacks) introduced a change in the API. The callbacks no longer have the topic name in its signature.
values.title: Remove topic names from all the callbacks

summary.raw: [This Ignition Transport pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/95/remove-topic-name-from-user-callbacks) introduced a change in the API. The callbacks no longer have the topic name in its signature.
summary.html: This Ignition Transport pull request introduced a change in the API. The callbacks no longer have the topic name in its signature.

values.description:
This pull request adds a spring compression test task.

The goal of this task is to setup a metric for differentiating manipulation dexterity through the use of a simulated spring with two thin circular end plates. The goal of the task is to compress the spring without buckling it.  Three different springs with varying difficulties are provided in this example.
values.title: Spring_buckle_test

summary.raw:
This pull request adds a spring compression test task.

The goal of this task is to setup a metric for differentiating manipulation dexterity through the use of a simulated spring with two thin circular end plates. The goal of the task is to compress the spring without buckling it.  Three different springs with varying difficulties are provided in this example.
summary.html:
This pull request adds a spring compression test task.

The goal of this task is to setup a metric for differentiating manipulation dexterity through the use of a simulated spring with two thin circular end plates. The goal of the task is to compress the spring without buckling it. Three different springs with varying difficulties are provided in this example.
